decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the instant reanimator combo to quickly bring creatures back from the graveyard. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can reanimate powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats and protect its game plan. The combination of reanimation and control elements allows the deck to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

This deck revolves around the combo of casting Living End to bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Shardless Agent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Sink into Stupor to control the game and protect the combo. By carefully managing resources and timing the key spells, the deck aims to set up a powerful board state quickly and take control of the game.

This deck revolves around quick and efficient artifact creatures to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to generate mana quickly, along with Thought Monitor and Thoughtcast for card advantage, the goal is to flood the board with cheap threats like Kappa Cannoneer and Ornithopter. Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Urza's Saga helps in tutoring for key artifacts. Metallic Rebuke provides some interaction, while Shadowspear offers a way to push through damage and gain life.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature play, burn spells, and creatures with evasion, aiming to quickly pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. Key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide powerful creatures with evasion, while burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment can deal direct damage or remove threats. The deck also includes cards like Seasoned Pyromancer for card advantage and Thraben Charm for flexibility in dealing with different threats. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies using hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and creature removal like Fatal Push, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. Ephemerate allows for extra value by blinking creatures like Solitude and Flickerwisp. The deck also includes some control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrath of the Skies to help stabilize the board. Additionally, the deck includes land destruction with cards like Bleachbone Verge and Floodfarm Verge to disrupt opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, and then bringing them back into play instantly using cards like Goryo's Vengeance. It also utilizes powerful instant spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to control the board while setting up its combo. Faithful Mending helps with card draw and graveyard manipulation, while Force of Negation provides protection. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its reanimation strategy and efficient removal, while also having access to additional win conditions like Ketramose, the New Dawn.

The main focus of this deck is to mill the opponent's deck as quickly and efficiently as possible. This is achieved through a combination of cards that force the opponent to put cards from their library into their graveyard, such as Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab, as well as cards like Archive Trap and Tasha's Hideous Laughter that mill large amounts of cards at once. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Extirpate and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's strategies by removing key cards from their graveyard.

This deck focuses on using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures and Planeswalkers. By controlling the board with removal spells and disruption cards, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game. The key strategy is assembling the UrzaTron lands early in the game to reach a critical mass of mana and start deploying game-winning threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes cards like Mystic Forge and Thought-Knot Seer to manipulate the opponent's hand and deck while maintaining card advantage.

The key concept of the deck is to use a combination of disruptive counterspells, artifact ramp, and landless strategies to assemble a win condition involving Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention, while controlling the board with counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare. The combination of Beyeen Veil, Fallaji Archaeologist, and Thundertrap Trainer provides additional synergy to the deck, allowing for explosive wins without relying on traditional land drops.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful combo using artifacts like Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher, while controlling the opponent's board with counter spells and removal. The deck aims to win without the need for traditional mana sources, instead relying on alternative ways to generate mana and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging powerful combo pieces and disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory using a unique and unconventional strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining powerful creatures like Ketramose and Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Path to Exile, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while slowing down their progress. Additionally, cards like Solitude and Psychic Frog provide removal options while maintaining board presence. The deck also includes graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus to combat graveyard strategies. Overall, the goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a mix of aggression and disruption.

Utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands and Eldrazi creatures, this deck focuses on controlling the game with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. By disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, while also ramping up mana quickly, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and versatile removal spells. The deck also includes various utility cards like All Is Dust and Relic of Progenitus to further hinder the opponent's strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early on. Cards such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and damage potential. The inclusion of control elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. Arena of Glory provides a consistent source of card advantage to keep the aggression going.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention to generate a game-winning play without relying on traditional lands. Various disruptive spells like Flare of Denial and Disrupting Shoal help control the game while Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide additional utility. The deck aims to efficiently execute its combo while disrupting opponent's strategy, ultimately securing victory through a unique and innovative approach to Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through cards like Thoughtseize and Flickerwisp while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. It also utilizes the Death and Taxes strategy of taxing the opponent's resources with cards like Recruiter of the Guard and Shadowy Backstreet. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plays while closing out the game quickly with efficient creatures and removal spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard effects, and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Fatal Push and Counterspell, while also managing the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Dreams of Steel and Oil. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide additional threats to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog offer card advantage and selection to help maintain control throughout the game.
